channel.title: Timers?
channel.description: How do i make timers start as the server starts and not be different for other players. I have a server restarter and i want to tell my players when the next reboot is, but the restart timer is different for every person! i want to use a code like this:[code]sendQuest("@gr1@Server reboot in: @whi@"+ResetTimer / 2 / 60+"@gr1@ mins!", 7332);[/code]. How would i make the timer not be individual and be the same for everone?

item.title: Timers?
item.dc:creator: @blazefire blazefire
item.description:
@blazefire wrote:

[quote=“i ancients i, post:4, topic:111188”]well, if the whole server reboots it doesn’t matter if they are at different times bc its getting re booted no no matter what…[/quote]yes… but i want to show everyone how much time till it reboots and give warnings. I dont know how to do that because the timers say different things.[br][size=1]Posted on: June 14, 2007, 11:52:13 PM[/size][hr]it’s been 12 hours. i still need help.

Read full topic

item.title: Timers?
item.dc:creator: @blazefire blazefire
item.description:
@blazefire wrote:

[quote=“i ancients i, post:2, topic:111188”]how in the hell is the auto restarter a different time for every1? i don’t understand…how can that be…[/quote] when a person logs in, the timer starts counting down. Once that timer reaches 0, the server reboots. The problem is that when someone else loggs in, their restart timer also starts counting down. The tiners are different but as soon as either one reaches 0, the whole server reboots. I want to make the timers the same for both people. how would i do that?

Read full topic
